about_the_game:
GAME STORY
Journalist Mustafa, who heard the news of a demon attack in one of the remote villages of Turkey in 1988, immediately got into his car to investigate the incident and set off. After arriving there and staying for a few days, he leaves his camera to the little boy Mert who was there and leaves. One year after he left, there was a massacre in the houses and many people saw the news that they were killed by the "Karadedeler".
Mustafa sets out to illuminate the truth behind this and to learn what happened to Mert.

PLACE
It takes place in 1989 in the village where the KaraDedeler incident took place. Mysterious things are going on in the village.

NOTE
Nothing is as it seems. Trusting your feelings will get you to the good end.

Game Mechanics
Puzzle and exploration are at the forefront of this game with a first-person camera angle.
Although Jumpscare is almost nonexistent, it tries to keep the pressure on you with the atmosphere.
Take pictures of the evidence. Watch the videotapes. Research the facts and tell everyone.
Otherwise, those who died there will have died in vain. Understand and learn the secret messages.
Physics-based mindful puzzles and more...


3 DİFFERENT ENDİNG
3 normal endings, Good, Bad and Neutral, and 1 top secret secret ending.

name: KaraDedeler 1989

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: Quad-core Intel ya da AMD processor, 2.3 GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon 5000 HD
  • Storage: 4500 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: You can play 960x540 30fps with minimum system requirements.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Amd Ryzen5 1600 or intel 9100f
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon Rx580 or Gtx1050Ti
  • Storage: 4500 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: 1920x1080 60fps is for ultra settings. The game was mainly developed and tested on a ryzen 5 1600 Rx 580 system. Unreal engine can be used as a base for the full test list.

short_description: Journalist Mustafa, who heard the news of the "jinn" raid in one of the remote villages of Turkey in 1988, immediately got in his car to investigate the incident and set off.
